Package com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl

Class ColorProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.ColorProvider

  • public abstract class ColorProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines common contract for target Color retrieving.

      • getColor

        public abstract java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns:
        target Color object managed by the current holder

      • byColor

        public static ColorProvider byColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Factory method for creating color holder that always returns given Color object.
        Parameters:
        color - target color to use
        Returns:
        color holder that uses given color all the time

      • byColorScheme

        public static ColorProvider byColorScheme(Editor editor,
                                          ColorKey... keys)
        Shortcut for calling byColorsScheme(EditorColorsScheme, ColorKey...) with colors scheme retrieved from the given editor.
        Parameters:
        editor - target colors scheme holder
        keys - target color identifiers
        Returns:
        color holder that delegates target color retrieval to the colors scheme associated with the given editor using given color keys

      • byColorsScheme

        public static ColorProvider byColorsScheme(EditorColorsScheme scheme,
                                           ColorKey... keys)
        Factory method for creating color holder that delegates target color retrieval to the given colors scheme. It checks if particular color key has a value at the given scheme and falls back to the next key if any (i.e. the order of given arguments is significant).

        There is a possible case that there are no colors for all of the given color keys - default color is used then.

        Parameters:
        scheme - target colors scheme to use
        keys - target color identifiers
        Returns:
        color holder that delegates target color retrieval to the given colors scheme using given color keys
